law.text:
A hotel is not liable for more than $75 for the loss of property that a guest leaves with an agent or employee of the hotel at a checkroom or other similar place if:
the hotel has posted conspicuously at each such place a notice that states the limitation on liability under this section;
the agent or employee gives to the guest an identification ticket that:
states on its face, in 10 point or larger type, the limitation on liability under this section; and
provides a space for declaring a greater value; and
the guest does not declare a value greater than $75 on the duplicate of the identification ticket that the hotel keeps.
